title: How to Make Pumpkin Spice Fudge

steps.headline: Spread parchment paper or foil over a 9 x 13-inch baking pan.
Pour the butter, milk, both sugar, pumpkin pie spice, and puree into a saucepan.
steps.description: Mix well with a whisk until properly combined and incorporated.

steps.headline: Put the stove on to its medium-high setting.
steps.description: Bring to a boil and continue to whisk well.

steps.headline: Continue mixing and boiling for about 12-13 minutes.
steps.description: The mixture will be at its soft-boil stage when a candy thermometer reaches 240° Fahrenheit (115° Celsius).

steps.headline: Fold in the white chocolate, marshmallow crème, vanilla extract, and nuts.
steps.description: Mix well with a rubber spatula until the chocolate melts, usually taking about a minute or so.

steps.headline: Pour the fudge mixture into the baking pan.
steps.description: Be sure to scrape any remaining fudge mixture with the rubber spatula to get every last bit. Smooth and flatten the top.

steps.headline: Allow the fudge to cool for about 2 hours.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Slice the fudge into squares using a cutting knife. Place them on a serving plate and garnish with nuts or extra pumpkin pie spice. Enjoy!

text: Pumpkin Puree Spice Method Spread parchment paper or foil over a 9 x 13-inch baking pan.  Pour the butter, milk, both sugar, pumpkin pie spice, and puree into a saucepan. Mix well with a whisk until properly combined and incorporated. Put the stove on to its medium-high setting. Bring to a boil and continue to whisk well. Continue mixing and boiling for about 12-13 minutes. The mixture will be at its soft-boil stage when a candy thermometer reaches 240° Fahrenheit (115° Celsius). Fold in the white chocolate, marshmallow crème, vanilla extract, and nuts. Mix well with a rubber spatula until the chocolate melts, usually taking about a minute or so. Pour the fudge mixture into the baking pan. Be sure to scrape any remaining fudge mixture with the rubber spatula to get every last bit. Smooth and flatten the top. Allow the fudge to cool for about 2 hours. Once the fudge sets and hardens, it is ready to be served. For quicker cooling, place the fudge in the fridge for about an hour to harden and set faster. Serve. Slice the fudge into squares using a cutting knife. Place them on a serving plate and garnish with nuts or extra pumpkin pie spice. Enjoy! Pumpkin Spice Method Spread parchment paper or foil over a 9 x 13-inch baking pan.  Combine the melted chocolate and milk together in a large bowl. Mix well until fully combined. Add the pumpkin pie spice and cinnamon. Stir well. Pour the fudge mixture into the baking pan. Be sure to scrape any remaining fudge mixture with the rubber spatula to get every last bit. Smooth and flatten the top. Allow the fudge to cool for about 2 hours. Once the fudge sets and hardens, it is ready to be served. For quicker cooling, place the fudge in the fridge for about an hour to harden and set faster. For a sweeter taste, you are welcomed to dust the fudge with any remaining pumpkin pie spice. Serve. Slice the fudge into squares using a cutting knife. Place them on a serving plate and garnish with nuts or extra pumpkin pie spice. Enjoy!
